citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
Availability of records.
At the time of the inspection, the Licensee could not locate the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) that is required
under the AWA when an exhibitor employs a part-time Attending Veterinarian. As a result, the written PVC could not be
reviewed during the inspection.
Per this Section. all documents that are required to be kept under the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) should be available at
the time of an inspection so the required documents can be reviewed to determine the facility's compliance with the
provisions of the AWA. Copies of all documents and records required under the AWA need to be on the premises and
available for review. Correct by 7/24/23.

Although the Licensee has developed and there is a Contingency Plan in place, the animal caretaker who started work at
the facility in early May 2023 has not been trained on the Plan.
Per this Section, exhibitors must provide training for their personnel regarding their roles and responsibilities as outlined in
the Contingency Plan and the training must be conducted within 30 days of their start date.Training of personnel on the
provisions of the facility’s Contingency Plan ensures all employees are familiar with the Plan and the animals receive
proper care during emergency situations. Correct by 7/24/23.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives. *END OF REPORT*
